title: Ticket #3713: condor_status -submitters doubles running job count
description:
Email from LIGO:

Since upgrading to Condor 8.0, we're seeing a discrepancy in the number of running jobs reported by condor_status. Specifically, invoking condor_status with -submitters as an option reports twice the actual number of running jobs. The trigger seems to be the -submitters option, as condor_status by itself works fine: 

      [root@ldas-grid ~]# condor_q | tail -1
      3114 jobs; 0 completed, 0 removed, 1604 idle, 1510
      running, 0 held, 0 suspended
      [root@ldas-grid ~]# condor_status -total -pool gridmon
                           Total Owner Claimed Unclaimed ...


              X86_64/LINUX  1496     0    1496         0 ...


                     Total  1496     0    1496         0 ...


      [root@ldas-grid ~]# condor_status -total -pool gridmon
      -submitters
                             RunningJobs           IdleJobs           HeldJobs


      jveitch@ldas.ligo-wa   2126                  937                  0
      nchriste@ldas.ligo-w    104                   48                  0
      pbaker@ldas.ligo-wa.    762                  619                  0


                     Total   2992                 1604                  0

Judging from the vulture plots showing more running jobs than available slots (e.g. https://ldas-gridmon.ligo.caltech.edu/vulture/), this problem is not limited to LHO. Is there a suggested workaround?

2013-Jun-26 17:17:17 by adesmet:
Bug probably found.

/src/condor_schedd.V6/schedd.cpp around line 1118: 

if (rec->shadowRec && !rec->pool) {
		// Sum up the # of cpus claimed by this user and advertise it as
		// WeightedJobsRunning.  Technically, should look at SlotWeight
		// but the IdleJobRunning only know about request_cpus, etc.
		// and hard-codes cpus as the weight, so we do the same here.
		// This is needed as the HGQ code in the negotitator needs to
		// know weighted demand to dole out surplus properly.
	int request_cpus = 1;
	++Owners[OwnerNum].JobsRunning;
	if (rec->my_match_ad) {
		if(0 == rec->my_match_ad->LookupInteger(ATTR_CPUS, request_cpus)) {
			request_cpus = 1;
		}
	}
	Owners[OwnerNum].WeightedJobsRunning += request_cpus;
	Owners[OwnerNum].JobsRunning++;
} else {                // in remote pool, so add to Flocked count

Notice that Owners[OwnerNum].JobsRunning is incremented twice inside that block.

Once upon a time the body of this block was a simple 

Owners[OwnerNum].JobsRunning++;
and nothing else.

Git attributes the duplicate lines to: 

0d408d87    (Nathan W. Panike   2013-01-15 15:47:26 -0600   1118)           ++Owners[OwnerNum].JobsRunning;

f1616f08    (Nathan W. Panike   2013-04-15 14:43:23 -0500   1125)           Owners[OwnerNum].JobsRunning++;

The individual commits look harmless enough. But one of the commits is (partially) a revert, and later the two commits were merged. I'm tracking down the point where it all went to crap, but my guess is that in the merge git forgot that they were the same line and kept both.

2013-Jun-26 17:28:27 by adesmet:
0d408d87 - Swaps from post-increment to pre-increment. Harmless style change.

f1616f08 - Child of 0d408d87 - REVERTS 0d408d87

0955ffd2 - Merges f1616f08 and some work counting weighted running jobs - THE DUPLICATE APPEARS

2013-Jun-27 15:23:05 by adesmet:
Fix committed; we just don't doubly increment the counter.

2013-Jun-27 16:02:05 by adesmet:
Assigned to TJ for review.
